cspom.constraint
Interface CSPOMConstraint

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractConstraint, ExtensionConstraint, FunctionalConstraint, GeneralConstraint
public interface CSPOMConstraint

A constraint involves a finite set of variables and is used to define the set of allowed instantiations of these variables. The scope is ordered, and the constraint must provide a way to evaluate an instantiation of its variables (allowed or not). The evaluate method is dedicated to this task.

In some cases, one may need a specific permutation of the scope. The standardize method returns a copy of the current constraint with a permuted scope. The new constraints must allow the same instantiations as the original one.

The set of allowed instantiations may be managed by a Relation object.

CSPOM defines three kinds of constraints: ExtensionConstraint, PredicateConstraint and GlobalConstraint. The helper AbstractConstraint class helps implementing eventual additional constraints.

Author:
Julien Vion
See Also:
Relation, CSPOMVariable, CSPOM

Method Detail

getScope

CSPOMVariable[] getScope()
Returns:
the scope of the constraint

getArity

int getArity()
Returns:
the arity of the constraint. Defined as arity == getScope().size()

evaluate

boolean evaluate(java.lang.Number[] numbers)
Evaluates a given instantiation.

Parameters:
numbers - the instantiation to evaluate. For all i, getScope()[i].contains(numbers[i]).
Returns:
true iff the constraint allows the instantiation

getPosition

java.lang.Integer getPosition(CSPOMVariable variable)
Returns the position of the given variable in the constraint's scope. Returns null if the variable is not in the scope.

Parameters:
variable - The variable to seek.
Returns:
The position of the given variable, or null if could not be found.

standardize

CSPOMConstraint standardize(CSPOMVariable[] scope)
Permutes the scope of the constraint according to the given array of variables.

Parameters:
scope - The new permutation of the scope of the constraint.
Returns:
A copy of the constraint with the permuted scope.

getDescription

java.lang.String getDescription()
Returns:
The description of the constraint.
